input.adversity: I am making an app and its not going as planned
input.belief: I am confused and having a difficult time learning something new

permanence.detectedPhrase: having a difficult time learning something new
permanence.insight: This thought is focused on the current challenge and learning process. It's about right now, not forever. This is a helpful way to see things because it keeps the problem temporary and tied to learning.

pervasiveness.insight: You're connecting your struggle to this one situation—making the app. This kind of thinking can support you because it doesn't make the problem about everything in your life.

personalization.detectedPhrase: having a difficult time learning something new
personalization.insight: You’re saying it’s tough to learn something new, not that you’re bad at everything. This is helpful because it leaves room to get better with practice.

analysis.emotionalLogic: It makes sense to feel frustrated when you’re facing a hard challenge and things aren’t working right away.

suggestions.evidenceQuestion: Can you remember other times you struggled at first but figured things out later?
suggestions.alternativesQuestion: What’s one small thing you could try differently next time you get stuck?
suggestions.usefulnessQuestion: How might it help you to see this as part of learning, not proof you can't do it?
suggestions.counterBelief: Learning new things is hard at first, but that doesn't mean I can't figure it out with more practice.
